description: The Liberal government has split its border security bill in two in the hope of seeing some measures pass swiftly while giving Canadians more time to evaluate other, more contentious ones.
title: Liberals introduce 2nd border bill with aim to quickly pass less controversial measures

description: Marineland has threatened to euthanize their 30 belugas if the federal government doesn’t supply financial support. But experts say that comes with a host of logistical and moral issues.
title: Marineland says its 30 belugas may have to be euthanized. How would that even happen?

description: Call it “Golden Dome.” Call it a “continental shield.” Whatever the handle, Canada is in discussion with the United States about being able to detect and defend “what’s coming at us” in the air, Defence Minister David McGuinty acknowledged.
title: Without saying ‘Golden Dome,’ McGuinty touts U.S. missile defence co-operation
Carney raised Keystone XL pipeline revival in meeting with Trump

description: The most promising effort yet to end the war in Gaza was bolstered as senior figures from Israel and the United States joined the negotiations on Wednesday after Hamas handed over its lists of hostages and Palestinian prisoners to be freed in a swap.
title: Trump hints Mideast deal is 'very close' as senior figures from U.S. and Israel join peace talks

description: The Blue Jays will turn to the hard-throwing Louis Varland to start Game 4 as Toronto gets a second chance to eliminate the Yankees in the Bronx in the best-of-five American League Division Series (ALDS).
title: Blue Jays get fresh chance in Game 4 to push Yankees from post-season

description: The Ebola outbreak in Congo shows signs of containment, with no new confirmed or probable cases since the World Health Organization's last update on Oct. 1.
title: Ebola outbreak in Congo shows signs of containment, WHO says

description: What's President Donald Trump's endgame with repeated U.S. strikes on boats near Venezuela? Andrew Chang breaks down the threats the Trump administration says it's reacting to and why Venezuela's relationship with China may also be a factor. Images provided by Getty Images, The Canadian Press and Reuters.
title: Why Trump is at war with Venezuela | About That

description: Dolly Parton "ain't dead yet," the country superstar said on social media Wednesday following public speculation about her health.
title: Dolly Parton speaks out about health concerns: 'I ain't dead yet'

description: Justice Minister Sean Fraser rejected calls from five premiers for Ottawa to withdraw its legal argument calling for limits on the use of the Constitution's notwithstanding clause.
title: Justice minister rejects premiers' request to pull out of notwithstanding clause case

description: Ann Katrine Saettler told a B.C. Supreme Court judge in Vancouver that Rogelio "Butch" Bagabuyo wrote a "planning note" that reminded him to bag everything after, not to bring his mobile phone or E-watch, turn off his GPS and throw his garbage out. Bagabuyo is accused of first-degree murder in the death of his client Mohd Abdullah.
title: Former B.C. lawyer planned murder of his client, Crown tells court

description: Authorities in California charged a 29-year-old man with starting a fire that days later erupted into the most destructive blaze in Los Angeles history and destroyed much of the Pacific Palisades neighbourhood, U.S. federal law enforcement officials announced Wednesday.
title: Authorities say they've arrested man who set deadly wildfire that levelled L.A. neighbourhood

description: The man whose attack on a synagogue in northern England last week resulted in the deaths of two Jewish worshippers phoned police to say he was acting for ISIS, also know, investigators said on Wednesday.
title: U.K. synagogue attacker claimed allegiance to ISIS: police

description: The House of Commons immigration committee is recommending most adults eligible for birthright citizenship under the "Lost Canadians" bill fulfil similar requirements to immigrant applicants on language, knowledge of Canadian history and security checks.
title: House committee adds language, security checks to 'Lost Canadians' citizenship bill

description: The Department of Homeland Security publicly lambasted Zach Bryan, one of the biggest superstars in country music, Wednesday for an unreleased song critical of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE).
title: Zach Bryan responds to DHS criticism of ICE song: 'I’m on neither of these radical sides'

description: A judge has stayed all charges in the Winnipeg sexual assault case against disgraced fashion mogul Peter Nygard, finding his right to a fair trial was violated by police failing to retain records related to allegations stemming from the 1990s.
title: Manitoba sexual assault charges against Peter Nygard stayed

description: Former FBI director James Comey on Wednesday pleaded not guilty to charges of making false statements and obstructing a congressional investigation.
title: Former FBI director James Comey pleads not guilty to federal charges

description: The Israeli military intercepted a nine-boat flotilla trying to break Israel's naval blockade of Gaza early Wednesday in the Mediterranean Sea and detained scores of activists on board, the flotilla organizers and the Israeli Foreign Ministry said.
title: 6 Canadians among scores of activists detained by Israeli military on Gaza flotilla

description: Nova Scotia RCMP say cadaver dogs did not locate human remains in the search for Lilly and Jack Sullivan, who have been missing for five months.
title: Cadaver dogs' search for Lilly and Jack Sullivan didn't find human remains

description: Nova Scotia RCMP say cadaver dogs did not locate human remains in the search for Lilly and Jack Sullivan, who have been missing for five months. The mysterious nature of the case, fuelled by a lack of answers, has garnered international attention.
title: Cadaver dogs' search for Lilly and Jack Sullivan didn't find human remains

description: Ontario theme park says serious environmental issues and a "total lack of proven financial viability" mean the proposed N.S. sanctuary is not an option.
title: Marineland says its belugas shouldn't go to Nova Scotia's Whale Sanctuary Project

description: A new mandate letter from Premier Danielle Smith directs Alberta’s energy minister to advance goals aimed at boosting oil production, defending the province's energy sector and advancing major pipeline projects.
title: Alberta energy minister directed to pursue pipelines, boost oil production

description: In late September, Donald Trump designated Antifa a domestic terror organization. Today, we’re tracking the meaning and history of antifascist protest — from 1930’s Europe, to today — and asking: how did the spectre of Antifa become such a target for Trump?
title: What exactly is Antifa?

description: Police are asking people to shelter in place amid reports of two armed and dangerous people at large in the area of Ginoogaming First Nation early Wednesday morning. Ontario Provincial Police (OPP) and Anishinabek Police Service say they're responding to the reports.
title: 2 armed and dangerous individuals at large in Ginoogaming First Nation in Ontario, police say

description: Scientists Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar Yaghi won the 2025 Nobel Prize in Chemistry "for the development of metal-organic frameworks," the award-giving body said on Wednesday.
title: Scientists based in Australia, Japan and U.S. awarded Nobel Prize in Chemistry

description: Via Rail has offered $31 million in travel vouchers to hundreds of thousands of passengers whose trains were more than one hour late since last fall, mostly as a result of new speed limits at rail crossings on CN tracks.
title: Via Rail pays out $31M in travel vouchers because of delays

description: Senior defence officials from Germany and Sweden visited Canada in the last week where discussions included rapidly evolving drone technology and capabilities. The discussions unfolded against a backdrop of rising concern about how to protect undersea cables and pipelines from attack.
title: Canada and Germany talk maritime drones as Europe worries about threats to undersea infrastructure

description: Stéphane Villeneuve has spent more than three years maintaining an ice rink in Gatineau’s Parc Desnoyers, but a dispute with the city has him asking whether he should hang up his shovel for good.
title: Gatineau, Que., rink keeper locked in battle with city over sponsorships

description: Like Sweden, Japan and the U.S. before it, Canada will start experimenting with scaled-up factory-built housing next year — and it has plenty of lessons to learn from countries where the industry has already matured.
title: Modular housing was a hit in Sweden but a bust in the U.S. How will Canada do?

description: There are no regulations specifically designed for the crypto ATM industry in Canada, which has seen more than $1 billion in transactions across the country so far this year. That's despite Canada's financial intelligence agency, FINTRAC, determining crypto ATMs have become the main method fraudsters use to get money from scam victims — and several of Canada's peer countries cracking down on the industry with targeted regulations in recent years.
title: Peer countries are tightening regulations on crypto ATMs to fight fraud, so why isn't Canada?

description: Ottawa wildlife photographers have captured stunning images of a rare leucistic beaver.
title: Rare white beaver wows Ottawa-area wildlife watchers

description: Many large ships keep burning fuel and spew an entire town's worth of pollution while docked in our port cities. One solution is to make them plug into the local grid through a connection known as shore power. Here's a closer look at this global energy transition and where Canada stands.
title: Ships spew pollution into our port cities. Plugging them in could clear the air

description: About 900 hikers, guides and other staff who were stranded by a snowstorm over the past weekend on the Chinese side of Mount Everest have reached safety, state media said late Tuesday.
title: Mount Everest hikers rescued after severe snowstorm
